question_sentence: What antiquated disease is seeing a resurgence in the developed world, according to reports from Australia?
evidence: Doctors from the Sir Charles Gairdner Hospital in Perth, Australia said scurvy is a "re-emerging diagnosis" after it was found in a patient who "hardly ate any fruit and vegetables" and "survived mainly on processed foods", according to The Times. Cost-of-living pressures and access to fresh food have been suggested as fuelling a rise in vitamin-deficient diets.

question_sentence: The Labour government is to ban what in England and Wales from June 2025?
evidence: Keir Starmer's government is to take up its predecessor's proposal to ban single-use vapes. They are a growing source of plastic waste and the bright colours of disposable vapes are reportedly appealing to children, one in five of whom have vaped before the age of 16.

question_sentence: Vladimir Putin welcomed world leaders to a Brics group summit in which Russian city?
evidence: Putin's role as host of the summit was a far cry from the last Brics meeting in South Africa, which he had to attend via video link due to the international arrest warrant against him. Dozens of countries are apparently keen to join the emerging power bloc.

question_sentence: The former CEO of which clothing retailer was arrested over sex-trafficking allegations?
evidence: The former CEO of Abercrombie & Fitch, Mike Jeffries, was arrested after a grand jury indicted him and two associates for allegedly running a sex trafficking ring from 2008 to 2015. Prosecutors accused Jeffries, 80, of using force and coercion to exploit men at sex parties.

question_sentence: A plan spearheaded by the UK and Chile is calling for what to be given an elevated conservation status?
evidence: The Fungal Conservation Pledge, submitted to this week's UN conference on biodiversity in Colombia, calls for the "funga" kingdom to be granted equal status to flora and fauna in international conservation agreements.

question_sentence: Members of which group are suing Donald Trump for defamation?
evidence: The Central Park Five, who were wrongfully convicted of the rape of a jogger in 1989, sued Donald Trump for making false claims about their case during his presidential debate with Kamala Harris. The group, now known as the "Exonerated Five" is seeking damages for reputational and emotional harm.

question_sentence: The London Film Festival cancelled a screening of a documentary on what subject, citing safety fears?
evidence: "Undercover: Exposing the Far Right" follows a journalist and a researcher who infiltrated Britain's right-wing extremist networks, including proponents of eugenicist "race science". Havana Marking, the director of the film, said she understood the need to prioritise staff safety but said the last-minute cancellation was "a very unfortunate outcome".

question_sentence: Which Caribbean nation spent much of the week without power after the collapse of its electrical grid?
evidence: Cuba's power grid collapsed, leaving much of the island in darkness as Hurricane Oscar made landfall. The country's decades-old power plants have been struggling for years, with residents saying the rolling blackouts reminded them of the "Special Period" in the early 1990s.

question_sentence: What profession took to the streets of Athens in a 24-hour walkout calling for better pay and conditions?
evidence: The schoolteachers' strike has fuelled broader discontent among the Greek workforce, with other sectors also blaming the conservative government for austerity measures and restrictions on labour unions dating from a series of international bailouts between 2010 and 2018.

question_sentence: An amateur historian discovered a previously unknown short story by which author?
evidence: Brian Cleary came across the "Dracula" author's forgotten story in a Dublin library archive. The story, titled "Gibbet Hill", was uncovered in a Christmas supplement of the Dublin edition of the Daily Mail from 1890.

question_sentence: What position is Paul Worrilow taking with the New York Jets?
What is the current buffer distance approved by the Wilmington Planning Commission for recreational marijuana establishments near residential areas and schools?
What is the new purpose of the building that was formerly the Corleto Latina Funeral Home in Wilmington?
Where is First State Brewing Co. opening its second location?
What does James Mazzola serve at his food truck in Rehoboth Beach?
What new housing model is the New Castle County Hope Center adopting?
What restaurant does Flavor Flav famously support and promote?
What was one major factor in Delaware's loss to Richmond?
choices: Their defense allowed four straight scoring drives.
They didn't have enough players available.
They failed to score in the second half.

question_sentence: What unique product has the Delaware Historic Plate Co. recently started selling?
What percentage did Delaware's cancer mortality rate decrease between 2007 and 2021?
Which battleground state did Vice President Kamala Harris visit this week for a CNN town hall?
evidence: Vice President Kamala Harris participated in a CNN town hall in Pennsylvania, while former President Donald Trump campaigned in Georgia.

question_sentence: Why did the CDC issue a food safety alert about McDonald’s this week?
evidence: An E. coli outbreak tied to McDonald’s Quarter Pounders in the western part of the US left one dead and 10 hospitalized. Federal health officials are investigating which specific food ingredient had been contaminated.

question_sentence: Which two baseball teams are facing off in the World Series?
choices: New York Yankees and Los Angeles Dodgers
Boston Red Sox and San Francisco Giants
evidence: The Yankees and Dodgers are facing off in the MLB World Series for the first time since 1981.

question_sentence: What is the name of the telescope that is creating the largest and most accurate 3D map of the universe?
evidence: The European Space Agency’s Euclid telescope is creating the largest and most accurate 3D map of the cosmos. So far, the observatory has completed 12% of its survey and aims to unveil the full mosaic within the next six years.

question_sentence: What is the federal minimum wage in the US?
evidence: The federal minimum wage in the US is $7.25 and has remained stagnant since 2009. This figure has become a talking point on the campaign trail as Kamala Harris and Donald Trump have both tried to demonstrate their support for working-class Americans.

question_sentence: Which country has sent at least 3,000 soldiers to Russia this month?
evidence: At least 3,000 North Korean soldiers are now inside Russia, according to the White House. While it remains unclear what exactly they will do, it is a “highly concerning probability” that they will join the fight against Ukraine, US officials said.

question_sentence: Which airline was recently fined $50 million for violating disabled passengers’ rights?
evidence: >The federal government fined American Airlines $50 million after a multi-agency investigation uncovered "numerous serious violations" of the rules that protect airline passengers who use wheelchairs.

question_sentence: Around how many union workers at Boeing are on strike?
evidence: Around 33,000 workers at Boeing will remain on the picket line after union members rejected an offer from the company in a vote on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Which country was impacted by widespread power outages this week as its electrical grid repeatedly collapsed?
evidence: Cuba was impacted by nationwide power outages, with many residents saying they were unable to maintain fresh food and a steady supply of water.

question_sentence: Which type of plant is the most common culprit for fall allergies?
evidence: The most common culprit for fall allergies is ragweed, the CDC says, which can release 1 billion grains of pollen per plant.
